cIM2CwlRTlFf1wsZLcP6eg.text: I promised my wife that I wouldn't make our long-awaited UK vacation all about barbecue. When we discovered that world-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay had 'que on the menu at one of his London restaurants, she was kind enough to give me a hall pass for the day. I knew Gordon wouldn't be preparing my food himself, but I was still eager to sample the barbecue that his restaurant churns out.A swarm of about eight staff members showed up to attend to us as soon as we opened the door. They took our coats and umbrellas, got our reservation, and seated us in their plush lounge area for cocktails while we waited. The ambiance and decor at Maze Grill were both very inviting. Their spacious, modern dining room was classy and trendy without being overwhelming or pretentious.As anxious as I was to eat Chef Ramsay's interpretation of barbecue, I couldn't help trying out an appetizer first. We decided to sample the Chilli and Garlic Prawns, which come on grilled sourdough. The prawns were a little smaller than I was expecting, but were very tasty nonetheless. They definitely had some heat from the chili peppers, as well as a great sweet flavor. I also liked the bite from the garlic.Not only do they tell you about the different steak options available at Maze, they show you the actual steaks and describe the flavors and marbling in full glorious detail. I guess steak is more of a luxury in the UK, because their selections included a 12oz Wagyu ribeye for £130.00 (roughly $218.00). In Texas, I could probably buy a BBQ pit, a bag of charcoal, and four Angus ribeyes for the same price or less. I just stuck with my pre-planned entree selection and ordered the Smoked BBQ Pork Ribs, which also come with Chilli Pickled Cabbage. Since I didn't plan on more than a small tasting of the pickled cabbage, I also added a side of Mac & Cheese for good measure.Their pickled cabbage seemed like the Brittish version of coleslaw, neither of which typically agrees with my tastebuds. The cabbage was piled on top of the slab of ribs, so it came with its share of barbecue sauce. I found a nice crunch, as well as a pleasant acidic sweetness. The mac and cheese was delightfully creamy, and the crunchy topping added a good texture change. There was a good blend of cheeses, though I'm not sure what they were.I assumed from the outset that my pork ribs would be baby backs, but these were larger than anticipated. There was a thick layer of sauce slathered on top, so that was sure to be the dominant flavor. The sweet barbecue sauce was ok, but I think some molasses would have made it better. The rib meat was very tender. I couldn't really taste any smoke, probably due to the sauce. I'm not completely opposed to barbecue sauce, but I'd rather see the meat shine on its own. That being said, the ribs were still pretty tasty.There were a lot of great options for dessert, but we settled on their interestingly-named Knickerbocker Glory. I tried to listen to the description, but through our waiter's thick Hungarian accent, all I caught was "meringue," "salted caramel ice cream," and "raspberry". Good enough for me. This was by far one of the best desserts I've ever had. It was very complex: crunchy, nutty, creamy, chewy, sweet, salty, fruity, acidic, and chocolatey all at the same time. There were so many different flavors and textures going on, but they all somehow tied together perfectly.At the conclusion of our meal, the manager came over and invited my wife and I into the back to see how a real Gordon Ramsay kitchen operates. The sweltering heat gave me much more of an appreciation for the work these guys do. It was really kind of them to give us a quick mini-tour, and it made the experience all the more memorable. If I'd ordered a steak instead of ribs, I'm sure that Maze Grill would have been a five-star meal across the board. Regardless, it was really fun trying out some barbecue from across the pond.

T34HIW-wnTIU_1oNLZ4CfA.text: Maze was my first Gordon Ramsay restaurant - it was located in the hotel I stayed at for about a week.  I will give 3 stars for the breakfast and 5-stars for the dinner for an average of 4 stars.Breakfast is fairly casual here - you can order off the menu or go for the continental buffet.  I had the ricotta pancakes with sliced bananas.  Although they were nicely presented I found them somewhat bland and wound up adding more syrup than I would have liked.  The black coffee was also somewhat bitter and grainy - surprisingly the free coffee in the hotel lobby was much better - dark roast but smoother.Dinner was an entirely different experience - the restaurant got darker and the ambiance became more formal.  Specialty items are sushi for appetizers and their amazing selection of steaks, ranging from the least expensive Aberdeen cuts to the most expensive Wagyu cuts.  Note that regardless of cut, all meats are aged over 28-days.  They even bring out some demos so you can choose between sirloin, filet, rump, or my favorite, rib-eye.Our group ordered the sushi combination platters, calamari, and grilled shrimp as appetizers.  The sushi was amazing - loosely packed rice that was seasoned, and fresh fish.  The California Roll was a bit unusual in that it had additional stuffing over the top, rather than the flat disk-shapes we have in the USA.  For entrée, I ordered the Aberdeen 10-oz Ribeye cooked medium with a side of spinach.  All steaks were presented in a nice wooden cutting board with a knife labeling the doneness.  My steak was cooked medium and very juicy.  It also came with a head of roasted garlic which went well with the bread.Dessert was a bit unusual in that the entire menu had fruity items (Strawberry Trifle, Rhubarb, Tarts, etc.) but zero chocolate.  One of our colleagues jested with the waiter and was able to convince the kitchen to produce a chocolate brownie with ice cream.  It was one of their lunch menu items but the funny thing was many of use ordered it and really enjoyed the sweet dark taste of chocolate to finish off a heavy steak dinner.

qtrzRkF4KaTm8wR_F3E1og.text: The worst service ever!  If you can, please spare yourself the energy and time.  I checked in at 7.45, and it wasn't until 8.40 when I had some bread on the table.  When I asked the manager what caused the delay, he was defensive and gave me hundred different reasons as to why the place likes to take things "slow".  All in all, the food was not bad, but the service and attitude are atrocious!  Never coming back.

hdj6ncceOMybv53S48e1Fg.text: Underwhelming. Staff rushed and borderline rude. Food ok. Nothing Special.  Would not recommend.

JEXNznGD5qY446j2geSTbw.text: Disclaimer: I've never really found a knack for the appreciation of fine steaks.That having been said, I know a quality restaurant when I see one, and Maze is quality indeed.Whether you're a first-timer or not, upon sitting down the staff will bring around raw cuts of the night's steak selection.  The staff themselves are extremely knowledgeable and are happy to address any questions or honor any special requests you may have.  Now, down to the food.I ordered a 12 oz. Hereford Sirloin, and while I'm no enthusiast, the cut of meat was very, very good.  There was just enough fat for the piece to be flavourful and it complimented my side of portabello mushroom and peppercorn sauce.  Quality food.However, at the end of the day I paid more than 30 pounds for a meal that was decently filling.  Now, I understand that you're paying for more than just the food, but you get the feeling that you're paying MUCH more simply because Gordon Ramsay's name is on the door, and for that reason I can't justify the cost.Maze is worth the visit, but if you're going to spend upwards of 50 pounds on a meal (and that's without a drink), it's probably better to just splurge and go to Ramsay's flagship restaurant in Chelsea.

photos.caption: Photo of maze Grill Mayfair - London, United Kingdom

H52g3BYZBi-c_Yfx6_cjtQ.text: We came here to enjoy some steaks. They have sushi too but we had already filled-up on appetizers at our hotel so we didn't try any. It's in a nice location across from the park. The steaks were seasoned and cooked perfectly. I was tempted to give it five stars but four is probably fair when comparing it to some of the top steak houses in the U.S. or Japan. I definitely recommend this place.

dNlZacZFsQULuRzAePjz_g.text: I am a fan of Chef Gordon Ramsay! Maze was amazing! I had 4 courses set (Beef Tataki, Octopus, Duck Leg, and Chocolate and peanut bar with caramelized banana, ice cream) + seasonal Bellini (The White Geisha - vodka shaken with sake, lychee juice & rose syrup). Yum yum yum!

photos.caption: Photo of maze Grill Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Octopus, at Maze Gordon Ramsay (look at the lovely little flowers!)
Photo of maze Grill Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Beef Tataki, at Maze Gordon Ramsay

Ez7f0iVTX3NGSRWD_bKRzQ.text: My family and I had high hopes for our dinner at the Maze Grill  and we were very excited to be eating at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant but we left extremely disappointed.My wife ordered the Rigatoni with Tomato Sauce, my daughter ordered the Classic Caesar Salad, my son ordered the Smoked BBQ Ribs, and I ordered the 21 Day Aged Sirloin Steak from Scotland Beef.The ribs were acceptable and on par with expectations.  Nothing great but they were just ribs.  The Rigatoni tasted like they used pickled tomatoes for the sauce and was quite disappointing and unremarkable.  My wife did not finish the dish and after I took one bite, I did not offer any further assistance.My daughter loves Caesar Salads and did not like the Caesar Salad served at Maze.  She indicated it had a funny taste and left it relatively uneaten.  My steak was a complete disaster.  I ordered it medium rare and did my best to eat it but the steak had too many chewy imperfections throughout which left my jaw sore from chewing.  I must have "spit out" a third of the steak back onto my plate after giving up chewing on it.  I was extremely disappointed!!!I highly recommend you SKIP this restaurant.  It's not worth it.  Try eating at Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill in New York City instead.  I went into the Mesa Grill with the same expectations I had for the Maze Grill and the outcome was completely different.

80jaFDQjPgwi-VqoycWNtA.text: One of the best meals we've ever had. My Husband had their set tasting menu & I chose 3 small plates. Every dish was amazing. The sommelier was fantastic to work with & the waitstaff was wonderful as well.  At the end of our meal they gave us a tour of the kitchen without us even asking. If only Chef Ramsay had been there.... Then our evening would've been even more amazing.  We highly recommend

eREh5-1yTx0lVPt0ETpxBw.text: Very conflicted, given the 2/3 of my meal was a good experience but latter part makes me want to write an email to Gordon Ramsay.... Food was good not amazing, except the venison. I wait 20 mins to get my check, it's a small dinning room with tons of staff. I had to asked a few times to get it then wait another 15 mins to pay. Actually I had to get up in front of the whole dinning room and bring it up to a waiter... I gave him my card, I walked away to use the restroom, return and still another few minutes. This was pretty outrageous!!! I wasted so much time there and I was jetlag. An email is going to management tomorrow.

KsEz69_8nrlZ5zsbjTz25w.text: I've wanted to try a restaurant by Gordon Ramsay for a while now, seeing as how he's such a TV personality. I had the 4 plate prefix meal.The first course was a spiced butternut squash soup with shredded pork and a parmesan crisp on top. By far the best dish of the meal. The soup had so much flavor--rich and hint of smokiness and spice. The pork was tender. Great!The second course was a roasted poison breast on a bed of ratatouille. This was just OK. No interesting flavors, but everything was cooked perfectly.The third course was a crispy pork belly with kale and grilled pears. Was just OK. The pork belly was cooked to perfection and the skin was delightfully crispy, but the sweetness of the pear really distracted me from the richness and savoriness of the pork.The last course was a pineapple tart. Light and not too sweet. Great way to end the meal.I had the meal with a wine pairing, and discovered a new favorite white wine: tariquet! The service was exceptional. The staff were very attentive without being overbearing. Would definitely come back again!

nRpk87OzPkBSTJ4KR3Md-g.text: We've been to other Gordon Ramsey restaurants and we're looking forward to trying this out. Service was disappointing as the staff had language difficulties but compounded the problem with a poor and robotic attitude. We had meat, lobster, chicken, pasta and burger. Nothing memorable but more disappointing. The best dish was shaved cauliflower and Parmesan salad. Too bad!

photos.caption: Photo of maze Grill Mayfair - London, United Kingdom
Photo of maze Grill Mayfair - London, United Kingdom

GZbs4cIVmYPC7iSOOp_VBA.text: This place is hands-down the best restaurants in London in my experience. I have been here a few times and most recently last week. The service was incredible, and the food was to die for. We had a few appetizers including the buffalo chicken which believe it or not was amazing. We also had the burrata, and the burnt ends and both were perfect. For dinner I had Wagyu and I can say hands down it was the best steak I have ever had. I have been to all the top places in NYC as it is where I work and live and this was the best. The flavor was amazing, and it was like cutting butter. My co-worker had the Tomahawk steak, and it was huge and pleasantly tender and tasty. I wish I remembered our waiter's name he was so attentive and good. I can't wait to go back again.

s2v_K1X_OWxvfgCtDbozhA.text: This Gordon Ramsey restaurant is a well noted place in London. The location is nice but the decoration is definitely not what one would expect for a place of such stature. From the front door to the back house, the service was amazing. The bathrooms are a bit off, I almost had my face slammed in by the main door. My seat was directly under the brightest light in the restaurant, not good if you're trying to incorporate an ambiance. I was really hot and spot lighted the whole dinner. Getting a table was easy, no reservations. The drink list was not the best and the food was ok but definitely over priced. The bar tender was very nice and made me the perfect drink for a cold winter night.there was 4£ cover charge, no clue what that was for but oh well! Would recommend but not for the budget minded people. I would not return in the future, 1 time is enough.

93xF2RFySvXF5teXKxCOSw.text: We had a great evening at Maze. Excellent and attentive service and very yummy food. We shared a bunch of small plates and everything was delicious. I won't cover off everything we had but only to say the cured salmon, smoked eel and beef tataki were highlights.  The duck was also very good but I was so stuffed by the time it arrived, it ended up cold by the time I ate it. Pork belly could have been more tender. It was tasty but a bit on the hard side. The sommelier helped us pick the wine. Very friendly guy from Sardinia and he didn't balk when asked for a lower priced option. Overall, a great evening at Maze.

_b0tJOyWUw5MkV0Jvuf-HQ.text: Not bad...The soft shell crab sliders are divine but the burger was meh. I was expecting more for a Gordon Ramsay establishment but then again, maybe I'm snobby about burgers because they're quintessentially American.Staff are friendly and attentive. The food is delicious but isn't necessarily worth the pricetag.

G9v2tz9x8VutihOiRnChNg.text: Enjoyed a delicious meal at Gordon Ramsey's Maze. The burrata salad was exceptional, creamy and luscious. MY husband had the pork cheek lollipops and said they were very tasty. We ordered the US style ribeye after the waiter capably explained the difference between the European beef and what we are used to in the states. My steak was the best ribeye I have eaten anywhere. Incredible. We enjoyed a nice red wine and finished off with a scrumptious chocolate cake with creme fraiche. Great dining experience.

sevfx6vQU6ZMlMo2ISyMmQ.text: The Maze Grill was supposed to be 5 Stars, I wanted to give 5 Stars but is not, 4 Stars is because I was not pleased with some things.First, let`s talk about the good things =)The Maze and The Maze Grill have the same Adress because they have the same entrance!! On the right side is the Grill and on the Left the regular Maze.I had reservation for the Maze Grill.The service was outstanding since the hostess, going though the waiter, buses food runners, everyone (maitre too).The menu is very good and there`s lots to orders, the bread as couverts cost 2 pounds and comes hot with good butter, is refill you can get as much bread you want and I recommend, you can save a little.I had to start the spicy tune tartare. Very good, A little bit too small and hard to eat, but definitely delicious. They had 3 types of dry aged steaks, Britsh, Rare Breed and American, being the last one the most expensive. I chose the British, we selected Rump Steak and Rib Eye.We selected the temperature as medium-rare and medium well. Both came a little bit of. The issue with the rump steak, came a little bit tough. The ribeye, I felt that the steak was to small for a ribeye, but I thin the weight on the menu is right.But now, these 2 steaks were not very dry aged, I had better before, I think the waiter should advise and talk to the customer more about the meat because I was a little disappointed.About the sides, a french fries with paprika, DELICIOUS, and EVEN MORE DELICIOUS, the Portobello Mushrooms!Go for it, I recommend, very nice place, but go aggressive on the meat, do not get the cheaper british one

photos.caption: Photo of maze Grill Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Rump steak
Photo of maze Grill Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Rump steak
Photo of maze Grill Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Dinner

7fQSgM-gqaCSDLLp7SPdZg.text: OMG the confusion among these reviews is incredible: THIS IS MAZE GRILL NOT THE MAZE.If you are looking for the maze, look on the appropriate page, as this is the grill house in front of the Maze, called Maze Grill.  Half of the reviews here are wrong. So. Two restaurants at the same location, entering the restaurant you have the Maze on the left, a one-star (barely) fusion restaurant, and Maze Grill, a steakhouse. Both of them are owned by the celebrity chef Gordon Ramsay.My lady gave to me a coupon for a sunday roast at the Maze Grill, and we headed to the place on a sunny Sunday. The place has big windows looking directly on the Grosvesnor Square, which is good, but everything is ruined by the abundance of tables, definitely too many tables squeezed next to each other. Yes I understand this is supposed to be a family environment, but this is definitely too much for the amount paid.We seemed to pick the wrong date for a sunny roast: it was mother's day, and the first waiter told us there was no sunday roast menu, but after asking directly to the supervisor, the sunday roast menu was given to us (I find quite unbelievable our waiter did not know the whole menu, especially in a restaurant where service would like to be top notch. It's the second consecutive fault in service in the second Ramsay restaurant, and that's extremely unexpected and disappointing).Our entrees were a 3/5: my lady's cured meat board was lovely, with very deep flavors, while my burrata was a bit upsetting, while the cheese itself was good, as italian I can't bear the fact they drenched it in lemon and majoran. Why do you put other flavors when you have a splendid burrata?! It does not make any sense, you are just covering the delicate flavors of the fresh cheese and all in all you are ruining the dish.It must be noticed that our entrees itself were good, but they were actually uncooked raw ingredients. Good raw materials do not need any hardwork. They still managed to ruin one of the dishes thou.As main course, I chose the sunday roast, while my lovely wife opted for lamb chops. My sunday roast was composed by sirloin and bone marrow, served with Yorkshire pudding, brown sauce and a set of different vegetables. The dish was delicious, well prepared, well composed, there can't be any objection to that, it was just as a sunday roast should be. The vegetables were nice too, even if a bit blend and less inspired. But that's just me nit-picking, the dish was stunning. Same thing applies for the lamb chops, the meat was perfectly cooked and left no pieces while removing it from the bone, it was a very pleasant set of mains.All in all, it's a medium rating at this point: we had a couple of extremely good dishes, one that was ruined, and the service and the decor which brought down the rating. It's a shame, this place should deserve higher rating and I definitely expect to upgrade the rating the next time we'll get in a maze grill

uBnJ5DfqtaTg0UAxM1lFDw.text: Typical Gordan Ramsey restaurant with really beautiful ambiance and amazing service. Food was good though not very memorable. I really like the fact that the waiter that serve the food would explain to you what you were having and not leave you clueless as to what you were eating. Slight caveat would be that they take extremely long to serve the dishes. So for a simple 4 course meal it took them almost 2 hours to serve the food.

photos.caption: Photo of maze Grill Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Really nice ambience and tastefully designed restaurant

ANu4Zofz5WYzLSuks8bemQ.text: On one of our last nights in the UK, we decided we wanted to try a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, and managed to snag a late reservation to Maze Grill Mayfair.We arrived a little bit early, and were shown to the lounge, where we were able to enjoy drinks, a swanky modern atmosphere, and some sushi.  California rolls are offered everywhere these days, but this one was phenomenal, with very fresh and delicious crab.  I had a lovely gin and sparkling wine drink of some sort, and my husband's drink was great as well.For dinner, we both decided to have steak.  I had an Angus filet mignon, medium rare, and my husband tried a British-variety of a rib-eye.  Both were perfect, and lived up to any expectation we had from watching the famed chef yell on TV.  For sides, we tried both the portabello mushrooms and paprika fries.  Both were great.  The wine list was excellent.  Our server had great recommendations, and was both friendly and very professional.  The space itself is a bit loud due to how it's built, but is a great example of modern design overall.We felt lucky to get to have a meal here, and I'd definitely go back if I ever get the opportunity.

SYBotnVP1Ui4KXsO2lKi_g.text: Loved absolutely everything. It was a tasting menu and wondered if there would be enough to fill me. It was!Flavours:  exquisite. Service: outstanding. Ramsay should be proud of his staff.

XeQfgfRAplJLR1jyjZ0jtQ.text: Liked it. Good and delicate place for steak. The service is very nice although the place itself is a little hard to find.We had three people, ordered a burger with smashed potatoes, a fillet, and a rare-rib-eye; with wine accompanied and sushi and calamari for starters. The calamari is really dry, and sushi is just terrible. Don't waste your money on sushi here, the rice taste like not well cooked or left for days.Everything else worth the price. The steak are truly amazing, so juicy and fresh. The only complaint is that it is a little flavorless, even me who likes light flavored food felt like it need more spices on it. But the meat is just very right. The smashed potatoes is filled with aroma of butter and cheese, which is really delightful. We had a lunch there, the table is not hard to reserve. There are not so many people dining, so that it is fairly quite a place. Good to enjoy the food.

yZa3d0hBhKrFvrva5O_s9Q.text: The presentation was generally good, and the snow crab was a delight, but most other dishes, and especially the tuna and salmon were average at best. Maybe they were too ambitious in trying the Asian fusion perspective on some of their dishes, because the quality just isn't up to par in comparison.  Maze came very highly recommended, but it seems like one of the many formulaic Michelin star chasers than a fantastic place to go out and eat.Snow Crab: 3/5Tuna: 1/5Salmon: 2/5Pork Belly: 2/5Presentation: 3/5Service: 2/5Diversity: 3/5Price: $$$$/$$$$Satisfaction:Price- 2/5

ZMcFU5rGsEQMToJ-5GOSKw.text: The 2 stars are for the atmosphere and service. It was our first night in London and figured you couldn't go wrong with a Gordon Ramsey restaurant. I ordered a medium rare "select" 10 oz ribeye (39£) and my hubby a 12oz WAGYU steak (139£). We also got beer, a bottle of wine and salad, 2 sides of Mac & cheese and mushrooms. In total we spent 230£ about $350. My steak came out with burnt edges and medium well at best on the inside. (Like some other reviewers have said) I was not happy and told the waiter, who sent over the manager. She tried to tell me to cut into the meat further to see that is how they cook medium rare. I cut my steak several times, not convinced that this piece of meat was cooked properly. My steak looked horrible at this point being cut in several places. The restaurant is also really dark so it's hard to see. She finally relented and took it back. My new steak came and it was cooked perfectly. However it was gristly and had no flavor whatsoever. For that price tag...you'd expect to taste some good grass fed beef flavors. None. Zippo. Nada. Nothing. One of the most tasteless pieces of meat I've ever had...and I love almost any kind of steak. The WAGYU steak however was delicious...I consider ourselves lucky that this expensive meal was not all lost. The sides were also very bland. The iceberg salad was (13£) shockingly boring. It looked like it should be awesome, but was also very bland and disappointing. I wouldn't recommend coming here to anyone based on price and what you get for it. We left very disappointed with our meal that we had such high expectations for and was willing to drop some money doing it. Gordon Ramsey needs to come in himself and go Hells Kitchen on the chefs.

Y7YDzWGucVrHDwiRvJ8a3g.text: When we see a chef on television critiquing other cooks food, I wonder to myself, is this chef even a good cook? So, while in London I had to give at least one of Chef Ramsay's restaurant's a try, and oh my was I taken away. The restaurant was absolutely stunning from it's wooden floors to it's bright colored tables and chairs. This restaurant was more than I would have imagine in such a small, yet quite part of town.Once seated, I ordered the Sirloin and potatoes. The steak melted inside of my mouth, and I feel in love through every bite. During my dinning experience, the staff was very attentive (yet, at the time of my visit the restaurant was empty), nonetheless the staff still remained professional. Overall, I must say that this restaurant and Mr. Ramsay should receive two thumbs up and a round of applause. This was a great way to end my vacation in London!

6nrwXh4i0HK5PxB0LaqOEQ.text: Very small portions.  Not that special food. in total... waste. The restaurant behaves like a mingling area.The service was good.  Too pushy with the wine order.

0pN0rPhAmSEsqsnACYkdlA.text: This place is absolutely ridiculously delicious. I mean it. I'm not eating carbs right now so it was the perfect restaurant to stumble across while in London. Everything is so incredibly delicious and well prepared. The service is excellent. The atmosphere is great. Not too casual but not stuffy at all. It may have been one of the best cuts of meat I've ever had. I absolutely love this place and can't wait to come back while I'm here.

6JzbN4DmTxwTcOldXnJRDA.text: Maze Grill is an awful restaurant.Had 1 blue "USDA"  ribeye, it arrived medium well.Sent it back.  Next one cooked ok but not the real thing. No taste very sad. Probably some poor british milk cow.Also had blue "Wagyu " , it arrived burnt (charcoal) on one side (the bottom) very lightly cooked on top.Probably UK or New Zealand. £130 very disappointing taste , tasted it and sent it back did not ask for a replacement. Rubbish meat.Mayonnaise + Butter + Tarragon = Sause Bernaise NOT!All sauces runny and tasteless.Opened 3 wines: 2007 Clos de Vougeot from Meo-Camuzet .Badly kept = Vinagre.Ch Beaucailou 2006 no good.2004 Sarget de Gruad Larose = deadDisgrace to keep such nice wine so badly.I thought they where display bottles around the walls but apparently not...Epically rubbish restaurant!!!If you want a good Steak go to:Beast = Beautiful Ribeye and the King crab is amazing also.Wine list to die for.Goodman's = Good steak as long as you stick to the American stuff. OK wine.Gaucho Grill = OK Ribeye.

photos.caption: Photo of maze Grill Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. 130 Wagyu beef carbonised.  Not Japaneese Wagyu so quite tasteless. Still a crime to burn it... How can a steakhouse not cook steak?!

VzjPxmLLhTy1R9VPSgRIfA.text: It was good food, nothing super special though, especially the sides we ordered were perfectly done and the service was really friendly. I am just a tiny bit disappointed because my rump steak was medium-well done even though i ordered it medium-rare. I am a big meat lover and i had higher expectians on that

3wJFsW0A-Nn8Z98Ss2DSQQ.text: One of 14 Gordon Ramsay restaurants. Food was excellent!  Steaks were cooked to perfection and the paprika fries were delicious even to a non-potato lover. We also had salt and Szechuan peppered calamari and buffalo chicken fillets as small plates. They were delicious as well!  It's an experience one must try while in London.

76ndFbqrrp5hJ8gC3GN8Wg.text: I had dinner there last week, we ordered the Chef's menu, the food was tasty, but I unfortunately got food poisoning, and so did my friend. I've honestly never felt so much pain in my stomach. I messaged them explaining what happened, they read the message and didn't even reply. Disappointed.

bGss5YERoIetDmdd_4Muaw.text: Our visit last night (1st May 08) was without doubt one of the best culinary experiences we have had. Pricey but worth it  £150 for 2 (3 courses, 2 x soft drinks, water and glass of wine). Nothing could be faulted:The best steak we have had outside New York (in fact it was better!) - the broiler makes all the difference to standard UK served steak.The best mash (puree) potato ever . it was to die for! Even the fries, beans, and onion rings were without equal.The outstanding service, ambience, and innovative (& comfortable) seating area. Jason is certain to get yet another M Star and it will be richly deserved. We will definitely go back!

qG20nNuJ188vCWs6R8AgZw.text: The steaks at Maze Grill are great and the side dishes are presented with humour.All the food I have eaten at MG has been good.Some tables can get cramped and the waiters are second rate. I would expect exceptional service at MG prices.

vl6-YtstOnn71bz-ebgQqw.text: What a great place! The service and the food were fantastic. I loved the Tapas style idea of the Small Plates for starters we ordered 3 plates at £6 each making a great sharing starter of baby squid & chilli, Aged Beef with roasted peppers & parsley (a carpaccio style dish) and a Soft Shelled Crab, all of which were really good. Then onto mains where I opted for the New York Strip steak, which was one of the best steaks I've ever had, the other half had the Aberdeen Angus Fillet (which I managed to snaffle a bite of and it was also delicious). we ordered 3 sides each (2 Mash, 1 Mushrooms, 1 French Beans, 1 Carrots & 1 Spinach and Gruyere) which were very nicely served in little cast iron pots. I opted for the Made at the Table sauce where they bring you a basic tomato/barbecue-ish sauce and a selection of herbs and spices so you can create your own custom sauce, brilliant! I accompanied my meal with a spanish beer that I now can't remember the name of, which is a shame because it was really good and unusual, when it arrived I thought the waitress had brought me a Coke by mistake judging by the colour of it. Desserts consisted of a delicious Strawberry Sundae for me with an interesting Cream Soda twist and my partner had the Vanilla Rice Pudding with Raspberries (which I can't really comment on as I hate Rice Pudding but she said it was lovely). After the meal we were treated to a tour of the (incredibly hot) kitchen where we were introduced to all of the kitchen staff all of whom were very friendly and willing to answer any questions. If you do go the Maze Grill and get the opportunity to tour the kitchen, my advice is don't stand in front of the broiler for too long it's like standing next to the Sun! All in all a great experience and a place I would definitely go back to and with friends.

wd8UPKM01m2jjrR1KHTjeA.text: Well this is the first time I have eaten at one of Gordon Ramsey's restaurant and after this visit hopefully it won't be the last. On entering the restaurant the experience was a pleasure, not what i had expected initially with a modern cafe bar type atmosphere (not stuffy or snotty). On seeing the menu our minds where made up to choose the chefs selection (after all they are paid to know and create the best so go with it). The food was all and more than we could have expected. I can't recall exactly what I had, but what I can say is it was worth spending that bit more. The surroundings the same, tables, fittings and crockery are not your off the peg bits and bobs, but obviously specialy selected and chosen with the purpose in mind, as with the waiting staff whom make your experience a pleasure. I have eaten at more expensive restaurants (not as often as I would like to though) but to date I think this place is hard to beat. Unfortunatley I don't think this will restaurant will achieve Michellin star status but that is the fault of the michellin star guidelines not the restaurant. I will look forward to visiting other Ramsey restaurants if this is the standard gained at the others. If you love great food then give this place a try when in London.

QUaIrjh1sqGx59tOB1QpRw.text: My star rating partly reflects the fact that I'm not overly keen on very rich food - if you are then you'll probably like Maze alot more than I did. I did the chef's table which was an amazing experience - we got to sit in the kitchen and eat a 12 course taster menu as we watched the kitchen staff cook and serve the food under the watchful eye of Jason Atherton. Jason was incredibly impressive and really nice. The food itself was very well done but just so rich - one of the courses was deep fried foie gras with steak and artichoke. It didn't help that I have no will power and the portions were quite big, so I felt quite unwell for a couple of days after I went - sort of like a food hangover but I think that was probably my fault. The most amazing thing that I ate was the peanut parfait with cherry jam, the closest thing I've had to it since is a snickers icecream but that really doesn't do it justice. I sometimes think about going to see if I could sit at the bar and just have that, it really was incredible. This would be an amazing thing to do for a special birthday or a very small wedding celebration. It's worth investigating the price but I don't think it was too bad.

pUGg_n5aGxrn2cWsjaOxog.text: First things first the steaks are magnificent no matter which one you choose be it the FDA or the wagyu or whatever. they start at a very good price(if small but everything is by my carniverous rex standards). the wine list is definitely overpriced and you'll be hard pushed to find anything half decent under £30.To start we shared one of the plates, of rare beef, which was delicious. The wait staff were a little put out at this as apparently the more plates they sell the better. We then both had the FDA ribeye with red wine sauce, and ordered sides of mash onion rings and chips.My partner in crime was totally enamoured of his steak, it was a coup de foudre. However he was peeved to find only about 5 chips in his bowl of chips with greased proof paper scrunched up to make the bowl look full, hence I cannot say how light and fluffy they were as he scoffed them all down in double time.I did have both his and my bone marrow which gross as it sounds is delicious and thats how they make their fabulous red wine sauce.My mash was delicious and i did not share, but again only about a scoop in a bowl we did get one onion ring each and they were moist and crisp but not the best i've ever had.I had the donuts for dessert, which again were subject to grease proof paper to make them look more than they were.With, 2 cocktails, one average bottle of wine, one starter plate, 2 mains, 3 sides and a dessert the meal came to £200 giving our waiter £25 AS A TIP. Now dont get me wrong, I worked as a waitress and I know how important tips are but I also know that all my credit card tips used to be taken and used to pay for outgoings like new dish cloths to replace the ones that the night porter ruined.I also know that a lot of these restaurants use the tips to cover wages which is wrong.I am therefore against discretionary tipping and would prefer to leave cash but was not offered that facility. I will of course return simply for the red wine sauce but honestly surely a tip on a party under 6 should be as it says discretionary and not automatically added on to the credit card bill!

daNhLCtolA_EITGynMxUSw.text: I'm not a great fan of Gordon Ramsay but have to say that he has a star in Jason Atherton and that the food is amazing. The principle was explained to us as 'English Tapas' but it has more in common with the Willy Wonka everlasting gobstopper concept - you get fairly small sized portions but every mouthful is so packed full of flavour and excitment that it feels as if you are having full meals. There are great Veggie options so ask if you are vegetarian (or even if you aren't!). We've always wanted to try desserts (the peanut butter and jelly sandwich sounds great) but are always too full despite 'small portions'! We have always left with that slightly spaced out happy feeling that amazing food produces. The staff have always been great when we went despite some of the other reviews. We found them friendly, not snooty, and full of good advice and not overly trying to 'push' a big spend. Love this place and reserve it for special treats!

2EHSIFsK--6iV208yFoQMA.text: One of Ramsay's best. The small plates were great. Must do the Miso Cod, Lamb, Pork and salmon. Service was spot on!

ApgbFDqu3jamixwwKUgnDg.text: When we heard that there was a Gordon Ramsay restaurant within walking distance of our hotel in London, we had to check it out.I've eaten as his restaurants in other parts of the world so I expect certain standards. The first thing I noticed when we entered was that it was very loud! There is a private, "Chefs Table" on an elevated platform in the back of the restaurant. Around 12 men were up there and were being so obnoxiously loud that I literally had to yell at my my wife and daughter who were sitting across fro me. Seriously, I had to yell at them across the table to be heard. Naturally it's a chain reaction. You have to be loud to be heard, the next table had to be louder, etc. I even asked our waiter if it was always so loud. He blamed the football game but it was all coming from the private table. When I wanted another ice tea I had to flag down the Maitre d' and then five minutes later our waiter showed up and I asked him as well. Ten minutes later I finally got my ice tea! From a service and atmosphere standpoint, this was WAY below par of what a Gordan Ramsay restaurant should be. The only thing that was at the quality and standards I expected was the food. My wife and I ordered the beef Wellington for two and it was out of this world. Cooked to perfection and so tender and juicy it melted in your mouth. We opted to skip dessert just to get out of there and out to the street where it was quiet! Stepping out of the restaurant we all looked at each other and laughed at finally being able to hear each other.

tZq00gJjD5tiluLIokUxxw.text: We were staying at the Marriott Grovner's Square and The Maze is the restaurant for the hotel. We had a reservation for 630PM and when we arrived were seated between two windows , next to a vacant wall. There were six other people in this very large restaurant and empty seats and tables all over the place.  We were well dressed, sport jacket for me, fancy sweater on wife. After much discussion finally seated next to a window.After being reseated service improved and was not overly obtrusive.We had the sushi plate and it was very good, other than having a soft cheese on top of some of the rolls.The restaurant pretentious and does not carry it off with great aplomb. Managerial staff stuffed into jackets, plates taken away from table when one diner not finished.  Hate to say but this place is over rated.. Had breakfast here with friends a few days later.  OK nothing special.

MK4yt3ua8LrkBqw5xdccjg.text: Came here for the lamb and bone marrow mash. Both were on the menu online but not at the restaurant. Avocado mash was good. Calamari was good. They will only cook burgers medium well to well!! Disappointing so I got the expensive steak and it arrived a bit cold after waiting an hour for it. Do not sit at table next the the steps that go to hotel. Flooded with people coming through with their luggage. Also waiters hang out there chatting behind me. Very annoying. Not a great dining experience but food was good. FYI. This place charges a cover charge, VAT and service charge. There are no table cloths and it is not fancy.

NY-b9MyIDCI23p_tFvW1vQ.text: This place has rude servers and was completely vacant when I arrived.  I recognize that I arrived 45 minutes before closing but was treated in a poor manor.  This restaurant is in a hotel and should serve food till the closing time.

S0ACAv8f3mMHslb1CPlKnA.text: As an anglophile I love anything GR related and Maze did not disappoint. They had a special menu and it was delicious. I would definitely return. I was very impressed with the atmosphere and the service. Very posh. The popcorn chicken was myFave

q8oiVVoX8sPANV1FM0Ndiw.text: It is not considered as one of the fanciest Gordon Ramsay restaurants but the service and quality is nothing less.This place is brilliant, one of the best restaurant experiences i've ever had. They have staff for every small thing to make sure each guest gets the expected care.We had the Wagyu and Fillet. Of course the Wagyu is the most expensive meat however it is well worth the spend when you go there. It is by far the best meat i've ever had.Fillet was awesome, cooked perfectly and my personal preference was chips with chipotle bbq.For dessert had the lemon yoghurt which is perfect for cleaning your taste buds after a heavy stake.All-in-all an excellent experience, food is world class and you feel like a VIP whilst there.

yCtUuA1hRV9U30cQXs-qjg.text: I tried ordering from here TWICE as we were staying at the Marriott Grovesnor  Square. First I tried to order something off the kids menu for my son so he could eat while we were waiting for our room. We had a 9 hr flight from Florida US and I wanted him to eat some warm food. It turns out that they do not do "take out". I was kinda im shock but I was just like whatever I guess. second time I tried to order room service for some dessert and we didn't have the hotel menu because it looks like room service took it away, instead the answer i got was "call front desk and they'll bring you a new menu" I guess Ramsey didn't do a good job on this one

SYzB_duiBbIH_5FJyYEkkw.text: One has little to complain about when eating at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant in London and a beautifully prepared rib-eye, served at medium rare and seared to perfection, is placed in front of you. Fresh ingredients and simply a very good meal is to be had, indeed. Little, however, doesn't mean null. You see, I personally have a hard time eating a 10oz steak. Why, oh, why can't one order a lovely "small plate" without hindering the wanted flavors that only a steak can harvest? As a matter of fact, at the time of writing this, the only dishes on the Small Plate menu are: Salt & Szechuan pepper squid (Crisp fried squid, chilli & lime), Smashed avocado (Sweet potato chips), Popcorn chicken (Gochujang, spring onions), Edamame (Salt & pepper), Burnt ends (Pickled chilli, brioche), and Buffalo chicken fillets (Chilli & lime). But, no red meat. I don't want to diminish the artistry that was created because the meal was heartily enjoyed. I do though have a problem with wasted food and gluttony, without any other option to enjoy the wanted flavors. The staff was beyond helpful, the wine was delish, and, yes, the meal was lovely. I suppose it's a odd request of less... just give me options so I don't waste food.4 stars = flavor and service3 stars = to bring attention to the above

9ZlByTNYWUX3R875UsFJqA.text: I was disappointed.  There were four of us eating. My wife and I were spliting a variety of foods.  The steak that was ordered medium rare care well done. It took a while to get our waiter back to discuss. They had also messed up the cream spinach.. as in, no cream.  He took it away and came back a few minutes later to inform me that he put in our order again. I asked him if he put a rush on it and he told me the kitchen is pretty fast. I told him that I didn't want the people I was having dinner with to be done before we're served and he said "I'll see if I can speed it up". Wouldn't you fast track that second steak without needing to be told?  Sure enough, our friends are complete, their plates bussed, when our steak hits the table.When the check came, the manager dropped it off and said I've removed the 12.5% service charge because I heard you had an issue.  More than anything, I was stunned that he had heard about the problem and this is the first time he stopped by.  Doesn't customer service start with him?Bottom line. It was $125 meal for two that was a bad experience and none of the staff really tried to salvage it.  I won't go back and I won't be sending friends there.  I gave it two stars because I think people tune out 1 star reviews as spiteful.  Clearly I'm unhappy, but I'm past the emotional point and just want to warn the next person looking for a bite to eat in London.   (Keep Looking)

vtbqBn3lUy3tFNc5difN3Q.text: Went here for my parents 25th wedding anniversary, had the beef Wellington which was absolutely phenomenal, family members who ordered Filets were very happy with there order. My only reason for not giving 5 stars is due to them over cooking my fathers original steak, however they quickly made a new one in under 10 minutes for him which we all appreciated. We are very happy with our decision to eat dinner here.

tkUuA8u6B6hOBjlpV2fjVg.text: The restaurant is very very good, the appetizers are delicious, the waiters are nice except the reception desk who are not friendly but it's ok since the food and the service are really really good. I really recommend this place for a nice stake.

photos.caption: Photo of maze Grill Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Wagyu beef

TpUpg7AMpMogNXOrLO-NkA.text: Overpriced and underwhelming: the Maze Grill feels like the hotel restaurant that it is -- no atmosphere, crappy music and the feeling like you are in a generic space.  Al forgivable if the food is great but alas our steaks were tough, under-cooked (we asked for medium and got rare) and under-seasoned.  The octopus carpaccio was criminally bland and oily and the onion rings were mostly breading.  Add to this patchy service (a shaky waiter spilling some of my wine on my sweater), and dumb aspects like the wine list on an iPad you have to request and it adds up to a disappointing experience.  Maybe Maze is better than Maze Grill, but I suspect Gordon Ramsay has seen better days.  The bread and butter was the highlight -- they were actually really good.

g2wUpFlpnk_ujH0NLrupSg.text: Our reservation was for a Friday 4pm dinner. We arrived early, the hosts were very friendly and took our coats.Waiters: All of them were very pleasant and professional. Probably the greatest thing we felt was that we weren't being rushed. Even at the end when we were largely done, no one came and dropped the check. We had to ask for it. It's nice because many times in America restaurants make you feel rushed which is something i personally do not like after spending good money.Food:We went for the current promotion of "One's on us". It is basically a 3 course for 2 people priced at 24gbp. To start we ordered the popcorn chicken and the spinach potato salad. The chicken had some type of japanese marinade and it was incredibly moist yet had enough "char" on it from being baked/fried that made it one of the highlights. The salad was more rustic then i expected. It was basically leafy spinach with parmesan and potato shavings. The japanese dressing was different but it was quite good. I expected a more refined salad but it the end i enjoyed it.For main course we each got the 8oz flat iron steak. It was cooked to perfection. One detail to note is that many of gordon ramsey's restaurants use a JOSPER GRILL. I highly suggest you youtube what a josper grill is so you can see the difference between a GR steak and what most restaurants are doing with regular propane/gas grills. The meats Looked lovely and Smelled brilliantly. Having that wood cooked smell/taste was incredible. The steaks come with a small ramekin of marinated tomatoes. They were very tasty. We got a side of grilled mushrooms and crisps. Both were excellent.For desert, and quite possibly the highlight of the meal, we each got the frozen lime yoghurt toasted meringue.The lime yoghurt was excellent and a welcomed change on the typical sorbet offering because sorbet is just sugar water frozen. The warm meringue they spread out on the plate was a perfect compliment to balance the yoghurt out and the crunchy granola type mixture really topped this dish off.All in all this restaurant was AMAZING. I give it a 10 out of 10.Minor details: an 8.5% "Service charge" is added to the bill. Also, there was a 4 gbp "cover charge" per person.

ClvqaO_ak7PBQ_d513pp6w.text: First of all, as others have stated, there is a lot of confusion by reviewers as to which restaurant they actually went to.  I can tell by some of the pictures that people are writing reviews for the wrong restaurant.This place is generally pretty busy, so I would def recommend reservations.  And yes, it is pricey and you pay a premium for this being a GR restaurant.  One tip is to sit at the bar as you can eat from the menu without the wait and the formality.  I will warn you though, you cannot actually sit facing the bar while using the bar because the bar top and the front of the bar are flush, so there is no where to put your legs. You have to sit a bit askew.Drinks:  Drinks are absolutely lovely.  Do not miss the Sea Foam Margarita!  I love margaritas and this is the best I have ever had.Appetizers:  I would say that this is where this restaurant really shines.  Some very creative and exiting appetizers. The soft shell crab sliders were perfection.Deserts:  Also, lovely.Main Fare:  If you're American, don't get the beef.  It's super expensive and for what you pay, does not compare to what you can easily get in the US for much cheaper.  (I can't speak for the super expensive Wagyu beef, unfortunately.)  The other entrees were very simple, but done to perfection.  It reminded me of having a grandmother or mother who is an incredible cook.  If you're looking for something outrageous, you will probably be disappointed.Service: I think sometimes we forget that the UK is a totally different culture than the US.  The staff here is much more reserved than one would expect in the US.  Our waiters were attentive  and did their jobs extremely well,  but there were not chatty as one might expect in the US.  (The one exception was the waiter that was not from the UK). Overall, if you're a GR fan and have a bit of splurge money, try maze grill - especially, if you're staying right next door at the Marriott.

photos.caption: Photo of maze Grill Mayfair - London, United Kingdom. Yummy drinks.

wjtNlf7P7nBQ0bv3vRpgoQ.text: Amazing stake fillet. Made it perfect (I asked for meduim but maybe I should have gone with medium rare).Service was ok, wasn't very attentive to the table. This is why I only gave it four.

O-g0kqyMOGAWHYKCntLtaA.text: My girlfriend and I went to this restaurant after reading really good reviews online and having also been to 'Heddon street kitchen', also by Gordon Ramsey, which was excellent.To our great disappointment this restaurant was just terrible...Most of the dishes were over salted (calamari, popcorn chicken).The onions rings were full of oil and the mashed potatoes were hard.Fish and meat were average (not bad, not excellent...).We started to think that the one and only objective of the restaurant is to make a profit ! What further confirmed our assumptions was that you had to pay 2.5£ extra per sauce and the wine glasses were really under filled compared to other restaurants (and I come from Bordeaux .Then the bill came with a surprising 2£ per head extra charge. When I asked the waitress why this was (in addition with 12.5% for service), she seemed embarrassed and told us 'Because of the room you are in, and the status of Gordon Ramsey'. I answered that I had never seen this in any restaurant in the world, to which she replied 'I could deduct that charge from the bill if you prefer'. If this is an 'optional' charge, why is it added to the bill without the customer's consent ? Would all customers pay this charge if it was known to be optional ? I was in pure shock.Total for 2 starters, 2 mains + sides and 2 glasses of wine : 125£We left the restaurant extremely disappointed, and checked the menu outside out of curiosity. It was exactly the same as the inside menu except, they didn't show the extra charge for the sauces - sneaky move..I usually don't write reviews online but this experience left us feeling so cheated that we believed that other customers have the right to know what's going on in this restaurant. In my opinion the only good point would be it's chic ambiance and decent service.I'd definitely nominate this restaurant to be on the next episode of Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares !Stay away !!

XutDNNMZsxCkeKnfWj9AQg.text: I love the food here. Bread is too good and they're very generous with it! Service always extremely professional but friendly. Also, like the location.

p1FpnRC9KmUkCPgArkvBCw.text: Came there for lobster and unfortunately they were out, but we weren't informed of the food shortages before we had already sat down and paid the cover charge. The food that we did order was very mediocre for the price. The dining area is very dark, so bring a flash light if you actually want to be able to see your menu. When I asked the waiter why we were paying for two bottles of water as we only had one bottle on our table, he got rather passive-aggressive. Thoroughly disappointed with the restaurant, only good part was the doorman who was very friendly.

3Nf4Yjv_shjpTyisQh-gxw.text: This was a really good meal. I thought the cauliflower salad was just ok. The British sirloin was really good and the paprika fries were awesome! I also had a great passion fruit drink as well! Gordon Ramsay has met my expectations. Well done!

WEwjCFZUy5z3ZeUMhkpDUg.text: Disappointing.  We booked at Maze Grill because we thought it would be fun to try out one of Chef Ramsay's restaurants as big fans of his show, Hell's Kitchen.  From the moment we entered, I was struck by how morose all the waitstaff appeared. With the exception of our sommelier, they were just awful - unhappy, robotic, unsmiling; the hosts who greeted us at the door were downright rude. While the menu looked promising with many of my favorite foods, it was mediocre at best.  I was really shocked given how discerning Chef Ramsay's standards are on the show ( but guess that is just the magic of television)!  The restaurant is modeled after a New York style steakhouse but the piece of steak I had was just awful -- far from the tender, deliciously grilled cuts of meat I have had back home in NYC.  And the worst part? The bill: 170 pounds (200 euros)!!!!  That was for the 4 of us: 1 child eating a kids menu, 1 child eating a bowl of soup (5,50 pounds for a very small portion) & order of fries, 1 adult eating 2 starters, and 1 adult eating a main and a dessert. Plus 4 glasses of wine (nothing spectacular or over the top).  To say we felt ripped off would be an understatement.  We've enjoyed such delicious meals on recent trips to London, this was incredibly disappointing and just a bad experience all round..  Sorry Chef but we won't be trying you again.

mkLpX-xAR-Gt3h3L_qYogQ.text: Absolutely stunning meal I had there! I did the tasting menu; everything was professionally executed + service was impeccable. Tasty food AND great presentation. Thanks, Ramsey!

qpTR3l38pJVQkgr5kqcoSA.text: The food was very good they said to order 2 appetizers and 2 entrees per person since it is smaller portions but 3 per person would be enough ( we are both 200lb guys and we were stuffed )

zi1_q8nqGK8slyQwLQ0jtg.text: This is a great place to go if you want to go to a celebrity chef's restaurant without it costing a bomb. I went with my boyfriens very recently and we loved it. The service is great, they are only too happy to answer questions and come round to show you all the different types of steak you can have. For 2 it was £100, we both had steak, sauce, 2 sides and a glass of wine. Desserts were around £7 if you fancy it but we were pretty full with just the steak. The steak was a good portion but the sides were tiny portions, although delicious and rich. Fab location just south of selfridges on Oxford street, not far from marble arch and bond street tube stations.

VfiyE_5nAt8zWvf2bysPBw.text: My husband and I had the set menu lunch here. Very good portion sizes. We really enjoyed the friendly service, the decor, the food and the wine. Loved the mushroom appetiser. I had the guinea fowl, which was excellent. Ended with the tarte tatin. All fresh and tasty.

SiqQVhAv2UlM9vaKaYIWiQ.text: Great atmosphere, as i prefer eating small amounts of different dishes rather than one large dish this was the perfect choice of restaurant as its specialises in a tasting menu. Each dish was full of flavour and rich in texture. great ambience, exquisite staff. Perfect pick for a wonderful evening.

IA02m3QA1yvwlcvCpvrbqw.text: The food is excellent, brilliant really. We went for a lunch, picked the set menu with a beautiful mushroom starter, a beef main with lovely chips, and a wonderful apple tart. Really, really lovely. The service was extremely good, very nice and polite, nothing pretentious!

5I8-nt5EefmFANvCW1cx0g.text: We were only in London for a couple of days, but I was determined to try at least one Gordon Ramsay restaurant.  The pound is so strong compared to the US dollar, so we opted for lunch instead of dinner.  We ended up going to Maze and absolutely loved it!  I had the tasting menu and it was absolutely delicious.  Everything we had very tasty, excellent flavors, great presentation, and totally worth it.  The atmosphere was modern and the staff was very friendly.  At the end, it took quite awhile for us to get our check and then waited again for them to charge our credit card.  But otherwise it was a great experience and I will definitely try other Ramsay restaurants next time I'm in London again.

8CmpETmqMEq_zFI3ONy4RQ.text: I went here with my boyfriend (his birthday) and had the 4 course deal (£24) each. Food was good, maybe some dishes were slightly salty but nothing to complain about. Service couldn't be faulted either. The only thing I was really disappointed about was because it was a birthday, I called up the restaurant during the day to ask if they had anything special they could do (put a candle on the dessert perhaps). The man on the phone assured me that they could provide a complimentary dessert plate for the boyfriend. The promised dessert plate never came. I didn't want to mention anything because I did want it to be a surprise and I wasn't away from the bf during the meal to subtly ask the waiter. I was told on the phone that they would note the dinner was for a birthday. It was a shame and left me disappointed because I was really looking forward to it . I decided not to say anything because 1. didn't want to spoil a good night and 2. we were quite full anyway. Just thought to mention it here because if you make sure earlier that something is going to happen at dinner, then double make sure on the night....

Qydt6RRd_mSCPVyauNMpnw.text: A royal disappointment.  My wife and kids are a HUGE fan of RAMSAY and have followed him on TV for years.  We arranged a "once in a lifetime" trip to London with dinner at Maze Grill being our centerpiece.   Upon arrival, we were very professionally treated and brought to our table.  The table, directly in front of the bar, was extremely small for a party of six.  It would actually have been uncomfortable for a party of 3.  The apps were amazingly un-extraordinary.  Nothing you cannot get at any other somewhat decent restaurant.  The dinner was deplorable.  Fish was over cooked and filled with bones (although listed as "fillet").  The beef was extremely expensive and just terrible.  We could not stand to eat anymore of it.  The quality of the beef was even worse than I had in India.  I have spent years watching Gordon criticize other establishments.  He ruined our trip with his expensive, over priced, typical, and under achieving establishment.  SHUT IT DOWN!  You should be ashamed of yourself, Gordon.

qoFaI-E8EVtKnDbW6vXsow.text: Incredible experience! Staff are fantastic food is incredible, everthing is rich and full of flavour. Yes it's pricey but you still feel like it's value for money Have the shepherds pie!

42b9yfSPHDBCkSjY64CmsA.text: Been here a few times and we are never disappointed. The food is fabulous., the best steak i've ever had The staff are very friendly and have great knowledge on the large choice of wines available as they do with the food menu also. We have always felt relaxed and never felt pushed through our meal. The place is very modern, there has always been a great atmosphere when we've visited. very good prices., They also have an excellent choice of cocktails and other beverages in the bar area. Can't wait to go back.

WejIpJhp1Ov8Apkuau89_Q.text: This is definitely an experience, but whether it's true of a great Gordon Ramsay dining experience, I'm unconvinced. We had a fun night here and drank and ate some wonderful interesting things, but it all felt a bit like it was trying a bit too hard. We opted for the tasting menu, which of course meant lots of tiny little dishes that were just about big enough for a mouse to get its little teeth around. Definitely don't come here if you're hungry. Come here if you want to feel cool and if you want to try the Gordon thing, but from a foodie point of view, it's an odd restaurant. Don't get me wrong, the food was beautifully cooked and resembled works of art rather than food on a plate and the science behind food combinations was in itself impressive, but if you're in the mood for a nice satisfying dinner where you really want to eat something, this probably isn't the right place. It's perfect for business lunches or maybe even business dinners if you're all in the fashion industry and don't want to eat anyway. Lovely G&T's served before the meal and the service was pretty good, as you'd expect, or hope. One strange thing we couldn't quite get over was the ridiculous wine menu - it was an oversized thing that looked more like a hardback book than a wine list. The waiter didn't offer any help on the wine and we didn't know where to start. It kept closing on itself so difficult to have a quick flick and almost too heavy to pick up with sooooo many pages. I wanted to say to the waiter, just show me your top 5 wines and we'll go with one of those, I can't be bothered with this massive wine encyclopedia!!

vBQ1eMgfnRuPfdr3QJGiSA.text: Disappointingthe decor is bland. The entire restaurant (and especially the bar area) feels like it was designed by the person who does reception areas of mid-range hotels. Its cold, impersonal, and not comfortable. We ordered from the tapas/small dishes section of the menuhmmmpicture small dishes, then divide that by half, and then again, and those were the portions. So miniscule that you could barely taste anything. The scallops were lovely, as was the tiny tiny piece of veal. The lamb was nice, and the halibut was OKbut the BLT martini was probably the worst thing I have ever eaten (tiny tiny pieces of bacon on top of a red gelatin (tomato?), green frothy broth (lettuce?) - wow, it was awful. The quail was the size of a human pinky. Avoid theseThe staff were super nice, and I got a tour of the kitchen after our meal (we sat at the bar). Overall, completely forgettable, no vibe, and the food was barely passable. Not worth it.If you want good Gordon Ramsay, go to Petrus

8232xvXO2uM3jrVkSrMRYw.text: Had great expectations as usual with a GR restaurant and they were damn nearly met. They were full on a monday lunch and we had the four course taster menu. I really like the idea of the flight of wine a selection of three different glasses of wine to go with the meal; but also because that was on page one and i did not want to bore my companion whilst i read through a wine list that must have run to about 50 pages. We both had different dishes, so tried most of the dishes. Three were exceptional, including the lamb, the rest were good and only one mis-fired,(the prawn cocktail) so all in all a great fine dining experience. Yep, the decor is a bit bland and corporate and slightly scuffy but with that many people going through the door what else can you expect? But would i recommend it to a friend? Oh yes.

WOLB8fs77-Wei4Xul08IaA.text: The decor is relatively simple.  The atmosphere iss elegantly modern and relaxed.  The staff are extremely attentive.  I had booked myself a TT promotion meal, hence I felt a little rushed -  you get the feeling they are trying to get you out of the door ASAP.  This was however made up by the quality of the food.  The bread was served at just the right temperature at which point I was extremely excited with the premonition I was in for a bit of a treat.  I had chosen 3 courses plus a desert - watercrest soup, meckerl, duck breast.  Each dish was so perfectly done.  Excellent presentations and the taste buds were definitely not disappointed!!!  My dessert was a pistachio cake and it was heaven!! The cocktail was a little disappointing but hey you can't have everything.  I had ordered a "flat-white" since I am a true Aussie at heart, they went to all the troubles to make it for me.  Service is just great - you go to the toilet, you return to napkins neatly folded and presented.  What more can I say?!

EOWoMZnJEg7Q-9dpiDDFMA.text: Excellent place to take a date. It's a complete experience where you're essentially dining with, well, what some would call high society. However, it certainly isn't pretentious like some other establishments. I had the set menu of 7 courses which ranged from scallops to fois gras all cooked and served beautifully. Each of the 7 dishes was tapas sized but can still be quite heavy. With a bottle of wine and a coffee aftewards you're looking at just under £200. Worth the money though!

BgswkUsPrmRnTVT22fq3lg.text: I would agree with many reviews that the place is expensive, and the decor may not be to everyones tastes, but fine dining rarely is cheap, and interiors are always pretty subjective. I have been here a fair few times, and can say without question that i have never had a bad meal here. Book in advance for weekends for sure, and be prepared for a hefty bill, but also note the food is exceptional, interesting selections and mixes and if you have the chance, do try and get a group to the chefs table, an exciting dining experience.

oNHz0pQEXOW5tQK2lTL9rA.text: I had the best steak of my life at the Maze Grill! I opted for the Rib Eye on the bone, not cheap at £23.50 but worth every penny. The imported broiler that they have brought in from USA means that every steak has that perfect crust on the outside whilst still be moist and rare in the middle. The service was dissapointing, staff forgot to bring over our wine, and then our steak sauce and an apology was not forthcoming. The pricing is ramped up by having to pay seperately for each side each but all the dishes we had (gratin, mushrooms and mash) were good, but very small. Go to this restaurant for the steak but do not be alarmed by the hidden extra's or the steak on the menu for £110!

iaII_ZuXq7q0YQv2PxAbjg.text: Simply the best steak, meat I have ever had!!! Not only was it the most tender and succulent that has ever past my pallet but I knew what I was eating (I will get to that bit later on). Unlike most grill houses on arrival you are ushered to your table like royalty as if to say this way sir to experience the best taste the world has to offer the waiter is then called to your table holding a meat plate (whatever that is) which is stacked with 4 major slabs of meat he/she then spends the next 5 minutes educating you about the origin and how the meat has reached its spectacular taste (interesting fact the unique Chinese cows are apparently played music and sung to by the farmers, little do the cows know that this is all for our benefit). Actually it was very interesting and I spent more time asking him questions. The meal will set you back between £22-£25 just for the steak but I will guarantee you a substantial return of investment.

T_ZZhdDlxdxqnZ8GHVygmw.text: Ok - I had lunch here last summer (Pre Gordon food scandal) but its never too late to write a review. I had the set lunch and for 3 courses it was like £25? I think.. I had the girlled asparagus with poached eggs and grapefruit hollandaise for starters. OMG it was like taking food heroin for the first time. The damn asparagus was just grilled but - wow! The grill must be made from gold or something! The hollandaise.. it was like eating clouds! Just light and disappears in your mouth and the zing from the grapefruit just gave me tingles down my neck! Poached eggs are just poached eggs.. But they were very pretty eggs. Nice shape!Mains, I had the rump steak with chips and a side salad. I've had better rump, chips are chips, salad was good tho.. The dressing was delectable! It the dressing was hot, I'd eat it as a soup. Dessert, I had chocolate mousse and pistachios. If I was alone, I'd lick the plate clean. Sigh, wished i was alone for 5 secs. I really wanted to lick the plate. Bummer..I ate everything - clean. Used bread to wipe up the salad dressing. Went home and had food induced coma for 4 pleasant hours :)

eLC7y4E1SDoUf-ik_6S1EQ.text: I'm going into this review as Maze wasn't my 1st choice, as we only had 1 evening in London. My daughter, 8 years old named Adrianna has a crush on Chef Gordon Ramsay!!  As we travel across the US & now foreign lands our food experience have to revolve around Mr. Ramsay per my 8 year old Adrianna. We have go to: The London NY, Paris Hotel, The London in LA, & now Maze in London. Initially I was not excited over another Ramsay establishment; they are lovely bit @ times are bigger than their britches. I must say Ramsay VeGas & Paris is lovely, not my cup of tea.  Again, my 8 yr old is infatuated with Mr Ramsey & is dying to tell hi to "piss off" as in jest & to show she is his #1 fan. As I digress, we happened to be in London & made valid arguments to dine where she wishes. This evening my wife & surprise her & take her to London Maze, knowing Mr. Ramsey wouldn't be present.  We arrived a bit tardy approx. 9:30 & needless to say a child after an 8hr time difference & 20 hr flight was a boy groggy is an understatement.  She proceeds to eat sushi sampler & then let it be known she was done & tired.I am not a patient man so I hurried my meal, the girls went to restroom & gave me a moment to speak to Danya & explain my daughters love of ALL Ramsay!!!  Danya  did not take praise with a grain of salt , she reacted. & gave my kid the time of her life while she experienced her fears. @ overcame them. Danya did not Stop there but she brought her other employee of service over, Weronika & they took a dream to a fantasy. My daughter had already met the chef & staff, but this go around they helped her make her own dessert. To this day because of that kindess, she is speacialPS TO MANAgEmEnt & Gordon::I know & realize you only hire top notch  chefs & staff & your name proceeds your establishments. I frequented many throughout the LA/ Ny/Miami/uk, with always a smile due to quality control. Though I'd really like to take a moment to let you be aware of 2 spectacular employees that made an 8 year olds life !   Danya @ Maze questioned on why Maze & my 8yr old proceeded to tell her you are her favorite & would t stop. All on in all Weronika & Danya went above all & saw my daughter tiring. & made out expietence amazing. These 2 girls went above & beyond to assure great service.

1AhKNea-iZ_He8lVUN_F5A.text: Go here only if you want to boast to people that you have been to Gordon Ramsey's Maze. Otherwise, the whole set-up is very pretentious. You need to take a magnifying lens with you to even see the minuscule portions (nouvelle cuisine at its extreme). This is our experience and decide for yourself if this is what you want: We went to this restaurant with my wife on 25th April 2011 to have their 'Early Supper Menu', as part of a birthday celebration. Their offer was: 3 'dishes' for £25 or 4 'dishes' for £36 (with wine this would have been £45 or £56, respectively -- but neither of us is keen on wine, so we chose the menu without the wine). The very first impression was with the young receptionist lady. She employed a strangely sarcastic tone, when checking our booking. Then we were shown to our table by a very polite waiter. Our orders were taken. Unexpectedly, we got a complimentary glass of decent champagne. It was a nice start. We ordered carbonated water. Then the irritation started: a waitress came along and filled up our glasses repeatedly even when we hadn't drunk any of the previous serving. We were pleased, though, when they brought some bread (four short stick breads) and butter. Later on we found out that it was lucky that we had eaten the bread before the 'dishes' were served, because this proved to be the main filler. One of the army of waiters (there were nearly as many waiters as there were guests) kindly offered more bread, which we were pleased to accept. Then came the courses. For the first course we both ordered a dish called 'marinated beetroot, Dorstone organic goat's curd, pine nuts, Cabernet Sauvignon dressing'. The goat's curd was the kind you can buy in any supermarket. And now imagine the size of this dish: it contained three little pieces. Each piece consisted of two wafer-thin slices of beetroot - about 30 mm in diameter: just over an inch - with a teaspoonful of goat's cheese in between, and with a few toasted pine nuts on top. The 'Cabernet Sauvignon dressing' was unnoticeable - lucky that the name alluded to it, otherwise we wouldn't have guessed. For the second course I had chosen 'braised veal shin, rocket pesto, white onion risotto'. The dish came on a plate about 250 mm in diameter with a very small, maybe 80 mm wide central depression in its middle, and in this small central bit was the smallest piece of meat I have ever seen. The rolled up morsel of meat was shorter than my thumb (I have an average size male thumb), and it was about the thickness of my thumb. The rocket pesto was practically undetectable. The 'white onion risotto" was about half an average mugful in a small bowl, the kind of size they usually put olives in. True, all of it tasted great, I think - I only think so, as there was hardly enough to trigger the tastebuds. Finally, the dessert came: I had ordered 'hazelnut parfait, pistachio meringue, cherry sorbet'. This was about twice the size of the previous 'braised veal shin', so by this time I was grateful. True, the cherry sorbet was half the size of my pinky (and I have smaller than average pinkies). In the meantime the armies of waiters milled around, and kept asking useless questions. One of them didn't even try to pretend that he genuinely meant his question. In English, tone is everything, and he was giving away his attitude. My wife went for 'Loch Duart salmon, fondue of leek, vinaigrette of brown shrimps, horseradish' as the second dish. She was happy with the taste, and her salmon was visible without a magnifying lens, but the brown shrimps were like those small water bugs you see in fertile summer ponds. She was quite satified with her chosen dessert: 'Summer fruit crumble, berry sorbet, elderflower mousse, granola'. This portion was about right. In the end, as we were going to pay the bill, we were given a piece of chocolate cake (not charged for) to share between us - about the size of two normal matchboxes on top of each other, to make us 'finish with a smile'. It tasted very good. We payed about £60 for all this (that included one bottle of sparkling water and the 'service charge'). There are many other much better restaurants in London where you don't pay less, but at least you get a normal portion and genuinely friendly service without the pretence. I wondered how the waiters could serve those derisory portions with a straight face.

drdcjrOR1bpH_duYoPptDg.text: Wow wow wow! I was lucky enough to be taken to one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants Maze for my birthday and what a fine experience it was!The restaurant area is laid out in a circular format and we were sat in the middle which made people watching an exciting part of the whole experience. The atmosphere was buzzing and the crowd was refined but not intimidating or pretentious. You simply come here if you like (and can afford) good food.The waitress (who was wonderful) advised that we pick around 6 dishes each - 3 from the lighter menu and 3 from the richer one. Each dish came beautifully presented with a twist on modern British dishes. I ordered a BLT and was presented with 2 tiny pieces of bread, the best salmon I have ever tasted and the remainder in a glass as a soup/liquid version. It does sound a bit gross maybe, but it was beautiful. The portions are small but after 3 dishes I was full - they are extremely rich and the most delicious I have ever tasted. The trout and meat are just divine.When we asked the bill, we were also given a selection of complimentary chocolates which was a lovely touch. I didn't see the bill but I know for 2 of us it was over £100 and considering we only had a glass of wine for £5.50 each, and I refrained from dessert, the food is expensive but oh so worth it. I certainly can't afford to come here more than once in a blue moon but it is absolutely worth the extra pennies for a special occasion.
