jlRGUw1Pm9lj5yn6_b9Opw.text: While the service was a little stuffy and snooty for my liking, all of our dishes were excellent. I would return for a special occasion but the prices are steep - even more so than other London restaurants.

H9X6o0ZG9F7NLN-agf7MdQ.text: This restaurant is pretty pricey, not somewhere you would eat everyday but it is an excellent place for a special occasion! From your welcome to when you are leaving, you are treated royally. You are greeted with a smile and seated in no time (with a reservation,  never been there without one). The food is devine...It's so good!!! When you are leaving the person at the first helps you to put on your coat. The ambiance of the place is warm and welcome with nice house music that's is not too loud that you can't talk but loud enough to give you a nice buzz. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for a lovely evening out in London!

ZL5B3wJ10YZ78VMnfXQneQ.text: I found Maze to be a terrible value for the price.  I hope that I simply ordered badly, but I tried 6 courses and was left unmoved...oh yes, and hungry. THE FOOD:1. Salcombe crab, brown crab and toast sorbet, sea herbs, pickled black radish, apple vinaigrette (£10.50).  Extremely small.  The crab sorbet was rather fishy.  Not at all like the incredible lobster ice cream in Martha's Vineyard.2. Quail, kohlrabi, cauliflower in 'ras el hanout', burnt onion reduction (£10.50).  Tasty, but still extremely small.  Not luxurious enough to justify the tiny portion.3. Hake with cockles and bacon in fish soup (£12.50).  The hake was delicious but the cockles tasted either old or canned (neither of which I would expect at a restaurant of this caliber).  Bacon was good.  Presentation was attractive.4. Monkfish with oxtail and lentils (£12.50).  Again the fish was well prepared, but still rather small.  The flavor of the dish was nice and savory.5. Slow cooked Suffolk pork fillet and cheek, various onions (£13.50).  This was probably my favorite.  Everything on the plate was delicious.6. Roasted Muntjac deer, pine nut purée, baby beets, oats, seeds and juniper (£13.50).  Also quite good and at a decent size.  This and the pork dish were the only ones worth the money.DRINK:  My Pear and Passion Fruit Caipiroska was truly delicious and reminded me of Brazil.  There was a generous amount of passion fruit in the drink (£10).THE BOTTOM LINE: Don't come here expecting to be full.  We found the process of bringing the food out to be quite strange.  A guy (not the waiter) would come from the kitchen bearing prepared food on a tray.  Then they would stay in one position until the waiter/waitress could be be bothered to carry the plates from the tray to a table.  In many cases, there were up to 4 guys lined up at once, and the food would literally just wait on the trays getting cold.We were absurdly grateful for the delicious bread, without which, we would have left the place feeling rather ravenous.The attentiveness of our waitress left something to be desired.  My empty cocktail glass sat on the table the entire meal until I finally put it on the empty table next to ours.  Same with the butter and the empty bread container.PARTING THOUGHT: Does anyone else think the restaurant bar area looks a bit like an airport?

a0uzjY4am3aJ7XUHS-zwcg.text: Met friends at Maze for lunch.  Dined at other Ramsey establishmentsbefore and this was another pleasant experience.Service was rather slow and it took ages to get through what was meantto be a fairly short lunch.  But what I did have was good.  I ordered a Cobb Salad with Crispy Bacon which was spot-on, followed by anunusual and delicious Chocolate Pudding with pretzel bits in it.  That's it.Should've order something more inventive at Ramsey's perhaps, but sometimes the stomach wants what the stomach wants.Prices are pleasantly affordable still.  Thank you for that.

dORoznOeFCzb_dSUTKJF8w.text: I have mixed feelings about Maze...perhaps because when I was in London, it was February, terribly cold and rainy, and I was sans girlfriend.  But having scored a 5* hotel in Grovesnor Square for a ridiculous rate, I figured I could redeem myself with a fancy meal near my hotel.  Was Maze worth the high price of admission?  Hmm.   I will say I expected more, overall.  The desserts were awesome though...I don't know what the chefs put in the chocolate dessert but it was simply PHENOMENAL (excuse the caps).   And being a hotelier did get me access to the kitchen, thanks to the maitre'd.  So, on the whole, I'd go back, but I will say I expected more from a Ramsey creation.

59foQCpTYtxB2bQLq43gcg.text: First time in a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, and will not be the last time! Food was great, service was superb and it wasn't that expensive. We ordered a la carte, and each had 3 dishes and 1 dessert and drinks and paid around £180 for two people. Definetely worth an experience! :)

ma97Z999fUMUSq_wcLHBEw.text: Well, where do I start?! Quite frankly one of the most fun and impressive Michelin-starred experiences I've ever experienced.I was really lucky to be invited as part of a group attending the Chef's tale last Friday. We arrived, sat in Gordon Ramsay's flagship in Mayfair, and had some bubbles and canapés to start. Juicy prawns, tofu foam (hmmm, not sold, but ok) and vegetable crisps.When ready, we moved up to the table, which is right at the back, with a partition to separate you from the main restaurant, a big window into the kitchen and a door that leads directly in.Our server for the afternoon, managed the ten-strong table of excitable adults with ease, and our sommelier matched a glass of wine to each of the seven courses beautifully.For each dish, the chef responsible came in to explain what we were eating, and we were given garlic soup with quail egg, white crab with brown crab and toast ice cream, the most tender lamb I've ever eaten, a wonderful cheese course and two desserts - one of which included a basil panacotta.Though it truly was some of the best food I've ever eaten, my favourite part was the kitchen tour. For at the end, I got to help cook the fish course!!!First things, first. Cooking on one of those open topped ovens IS LIKE STANDING NEXT TO THE EQUATOR. The chef helping me (well, I was helping him) put olive oil in three pans, then nine pieces of red mullet split divided between them. Two minutes on one side, then I got to flip them and 40 seconds later. Done. Onto some kitchen roll, lemon, salt, then I handed them to the chef. After he did his professional serving thing, I had to introduce the food to the table, which is Maze's signature dish.I can still remember: "Pan fried red mullet with black squid ink, micro squid, garlic puree, a cuttlefish tagliatelle and a rabbit bolognese"Awesome!! And so tasty...I can't even imagine how much it cost, but if money was no object, I'd take all of my best friends here for the experience. It was truly special, and I'll continue to rave about it to everyone who'll listen :)

17AJwLLknfWLPM1cZ19jqA.text: Absolutely amazing service, food, place. 100% worth it if you're willing to spend the money :)Ceci

I7Ze31Hj8jcL4gNxqAVWCw.text: Sex or food? A tough call to decide which I like more. On the basis of the simply phenomenal dining experience this week at Mr Ramsey's Maze restaurant, I'd have to say... I think food may have just sneaked ahead.Upon arrival, I knew this was going to be a night to remember. We started with a French champagne, the first of several alcoholic beverages, and began to peruse the menu. We were told that for first timers we should give the Chefs set menu a squizz. 6 courses. 2 entrees, a starter, a main course, cheese and a pudding. £65. Spenny, but this way you get a chance to sample arguably the best things on the menu, reducing the likelihood of that common disease, 'food envy.'  I won't go into the details of each meal, but rest assured they were all incredible. What was great was the knowledge the waiters and waitresses had of each course and their suggestions for wine for each course we all equally spot on. With a quick trip into the kitchen to see how this well oiled machine runs, courtesy of my friend Martin who is the Maître d, you could say that this was one of most incredible dining experiences I've ever had. The decor is smart and simple. Nothing too fancy, it just works. I'm also a sucker for Molten Brown, so I took full advantage of the bathroom facilities.Granted that with a bill £1 short of 700 squirrels, this was a rather extravagant way to spend a Thursday. It was a rather unique experience because I was taken there for a no holds bared night. In a nut shell we were allowed to eat and drink as much as possible and all would be expensed! Therefore, make sure you go with a sweaty stack of cash because his type of cuisine ain't cheap. From what I understand Maze does a very reasonable set menu for lunch. Probably a better way to sample this incredible restaurant. Too surmise: A-MAZE-INGSexy Rob

0oyYJbErfSKjzjvXXW5TrQ.text: TASTING MENU!!!!I am a huge fan, I have never had so many different flavors and textures in food before. Dessert was scrumptious and I even asked if I could try the peanut butter and cherry instead of what was on my tasting menu and thank God I did because I would have missed out!

1McgDW7OZquFTQZsRykKLQ.text: Amazing restaurant, went there with a group of 30 diners for a team dinner and had a great experience with excellent food, good selection of wines, staff was also very cooperative. Definitely comes highly recommended

SLFfiV50VeV37olAobTZgA.text: A friend of mine recommended Maze for dinner a couple of nights ago. Being from the US I had not heard of the restaurant so I expected something nice but was completely blown away. The environment if very clean and stimulating, staff very attentive without overdoing it. The real pleasure is in the food itself. Smaller portions so you get to order a few things which I find more appealing to my pallet. Everything we tried was exceptional but my favorite was the pork belly. A very difficult dish to properly execute. Dessert was no exception, you must try the lemon tart. I will be returning during one of my future London trips.

CEVtYISFajxni7ABrWy56Q.text: Very good food, but overpriced for what it is.We ate here on a Tuesday evening. We indulged in the:Squid, very good. Nice flavours, fresh squid.Sliders, fair. Pedestrian slider.Nigiri plate, good. High-quality fish with good freshness.USDA prime ribeye, good. A very thin cut but tasty, perfect medium rara and they finished it with butter. Lots of butter. Bechamel sauce was a good example.Maze Sundae, good. Much more brownie than ice cream was an (unpleasant) surprise but the flavours were there.Creme Brulee, very good. Just a prototypical example of a good one.Their wine-by-the-glass was easily the smallest/least wine per glass I've ever gotten at a restaurant. More like a flight in a wine service. Their menu for half bottle reds (to go with the steak) was sparse. Four of them were between 25-35 pounds and the fifth was 77 pounds. I wanted something in the middle and knew I was in trouble with the cheaper ones. I went with the Bordeaux and it was a pretty lousy bottle of wine. Shame.The restaurant is a little loud, too. That's a personal preference thing, but my preference is surely for a quiet meal.So why four stars? The food WAS good. If I rate something three stars I generally don't care for the food. I would want to come back to Maze, I just would want someone else to pay. Value for money wasn't there.

VZ9y5BRJ54F4CxdatYkU9g.text: I was really looking forward to eating at this restaurant on my recent vacation to London.  My wife and I met up with friends who lived in London and we made reservations weeks prior.The Pros - Nice atmosphere.  Since it was 8 of us, they sat us in a private room overlooking the Kitchen.  Everything is very clean and I really liked the Layout.  The mixed drinks were very well crafted and tasty.The Cons - The service was very poor, rude and unorganized.  Waitress didn't really know the menu.  Don't even try to ask her a question as she will just stare at you.  They had a different person running the credit card machine and "idiot" doesn't even come close to describing him.  Also because he is such an "idiot" if you try to question him at all he becomes defensive and rude. Everyone seemed to enjoy their meals but I thought it was just ok.  Coming from Boston and eating at many high end Steakhouses, this restaurant just did not compare.  If it was a low end steakhouse like an Outback, I would say the steaks were good.  The sides were very bland and nothing really stood out.I did say earlier the drinks were good, well their glassware not so much.  I picked up my drink and the bottom gave out and the drink fell all over me.  I think the cups at McDonalds are more durable.  You would think they would at least give you a complimentary drink, but not at Gordon Ramsey's.Dessert was ok, nothing special.  Usual array you would find at any restaurant.Overall this place was just ok.  I was going to give it 2 stars, but that would suggest I might give it another shot.  I would never go back to this place or any Gordon Ramsey restaurant again.If you are coming from the US, I would suggest avoiding.  You will be very disappointed with the portions and overall flavor.  London has many wonderful restaurants and this place is not one of them.

34VJi2y9NDDu73cCPAm7hw.text: Eeeeeiiiiiii!!!  I had three deliciously tasty courses for dinner all for £23.50. No mistake £23.50...AND guess what else..Gordon Ramsay was casually walking around too (cue fainting and cooing) He was looking as delicious as the food (hmm is that wrong?)Anyway at prices like this what is not to love!!Oh - and when you choose your dessert make sure you go for the peanut butter and jam sandwich..yeh yeh i know it sounds vile but trust me it really is suburb..nothing like a sandwich at all actually - get it, you wont be disappointed..BTW- i booked it thru top-table for that cheeky deal

mzBWh5fUkUsyboBYVGnmuA.text: A somewhat belated review, but this restaurant is outstanding and everyone needs to know!The roasted Muntjac deer, the tea-smoked sea trout, the braised lamb shoulder...all outstanding.   Portions, typical of small plates.  I wanted more onnly because everything was so delicious!  Drinks, creative, delicious, and potent.Atmosphere is elegant, clean, and modern.  Lovely room and bar.Service was charming, attentive without being overbearing.  The kitchen tour was icing on the proverbial cake!  The chefs in the kitchen managed to be jovial while still keeping pace with the hussle and bustle of what goes on behind the scenes at a restaurant of this caliber.The mignardise was delicious and plentiful  All in all, absolutely fantastic!

uDJKOpkm08meSq-R90oVag.text: Maze is quite delicious.  I'm not a huge fan of the space - it's a bit too large and designed funny to be intimate, which is what I would have expected for this type of cuisine/experience, but I may be biased coming from SF where every restaurant has just enough space to exist.  We went back in November and had 3 courses for £25, but I believe that deal's since changed.  What I had was....* Jasmine and miso cured salmon appetizer - pretty good and went well with the pickled watermelon pieces* Szechuan spiced pork belly - can't go wrong with pork belly, right? And this one was no different.  Although it was very reminiscent to the roast pork you get at the Chinese deli.  Still, very very good.* Blackberry and something else crumble - loved it!  Perfect blend of tartness and crunchy bits and super light after all the fat I consumed in the pork belly.Overall, I'd definitely go back for the set course menus, as they give you the perfect amount of each dish and you get to try so much.

ccxICyHTW2jwMoFMXISUBQ.text: Very poor service, just like the staff has never worked at a restaurant before. Just some examples: we ordered main twice and both times they came back to say that they were out of the items. Many waiters per guest and you still have to wait a long time to get service. Sommelier doesnt know much about their wines or beers. Took forever to get the food. Waiter asks if we want more water and then forgets to bring it. Waiter messes up with the order and the worst thing is that they are rude about it. Poor value for the high price. The food was good though even if I was too pissed of to enjoy it.

_evon80B6lQ41v7hsfk_NQ.text: Very nice restaurant, specialising in steak and sushi. Good food and attentive, friendly service. The steak selection was top notch and ours were cooked perfectly to our request. Nice selection of sides and sauces and a very good wine list. Recommended.

00Xi0etIlI9CwEU_hZyNwA.text: Second time at this Gordan Ramsey restaurant and did not disappoint! Awesome experience. Unbelievable service from the doorman wearing the sweet bowler hat, to the three funny and charming hostesses and of course out superb waitstaff which included a charming girl from Melbourne Australia who gave us a tour of the six meats available to be grilled and a nice gentleman. I went with a friend and we decided to share and ordered the shrimp in garlic and chili and tuna tartar for starters. Both we're amazing. We then ordered to different Sirloins and the waiter asked whether we would like it sliced out of the kitchen which was a nice touch. They were deliciously cooked medium rare. As side dishes we had fries and broccoli which were just ok. Finally we had the special desert which had ice cream and marshmallow , nuts and a whole bunch of other stuff which was out of this world. At the end we were invited back to the kitchen and met the head chef. Quite a delightful experience. If you can afford to go, it is a very nice experience at a Gordan Ramsey restaurant.

FKvPTvg-c_LyvHOvyHrsow.text: This place has some of the finest drinks I've had in London.  If you like a high end high class place with amazing drinks and food then don't hesitate to come here.  Excellent service, and a clean beautiful look to the place.   The passionfruit martini was the best drink I've ordered on my vacation here.

SbvGvuCDZ-kPq9Iw-YVPgw.text: Enjoyed salmon with tangy coleslaw and a burger with fries!  Very good and great service!  No reservations but they worked us in and sat us at bar!   Ask for special menu of 3 courses for 24$.

SRq3fV1Qtl2vroUTud1gEg.text: Maze Grill, the bone-in Rib-eye is wonderful.  Nicely seasoned and done to order.  Very nice meal overall.  The cheesecake with blood orange was very tasty.  Late seating (8PM) was very unrushed.

ilGldD6bMkAhRxE9pct1-w.text: Verygood Gordon Ramsay restaurant, but to be honest I prefer atClardige`s. The atmosphere here is trendy, their menu is on iPads.The food is always good (I do not expect else) and the service isgood too. I give 4 stars just because Clardige`s restaurant isbetter :)

U5c8UZ6V9YESCjJA1RgoWA.text: Fantastic food, location and service.     Everything was great from start to finish even though it was a Saturday night and very busy.

f0LrfMxIubdnk21mz9B_mQ.text: The Foie Gras dish was the best i've ever had, it's a must.  Not as amazed by all the other dishes.  Also, a bit pricey.  But, what isn't in London?

_Rt_XiLJfDynoJ-dO0S_9Q.text: Service was outstanding, especially Kamila!  Really enjoyed the cocktails, the desserts and the ambiance.  Dinner entrees very good, particularly the cheeseburger, though the USDA ribeye was not worth the money.  Overall, had a great experience!

IRZCDpMp3IvHvhs8UUH7yg.text: Have to volunteer - we only had a few drinks and dessert here - and it was absolutely amazing!  The staff was excellent with recommendations for both - we got a bit lucky that we happened to be there around New Year's and it was not too busy and the bartender actually came to talk about what kinda of drinks we like.  Learned that - Maze actually makes their own Lychee concentrate fresh everyday - and their Lychee martini was out of this world - I am usually not a big fan - as I have found most to be very sugary - but this was crazy good, the fresh lychee makes a huge difference - and they also did not just dump sugar into it and ruin the taste of everything else.  For dessert we had - Bitter chocolate délice 'Black Forest', cherry ripple ice cream - which just melts in your mouth! Wish we had more time - would have been fun to have a proper dinner here - perhaps next time around!

6cMS4jmkODPU8WRv8Jcb3Q.text: The atmosphere is really good. Probably the best service we have had in a while. The food even though small portions was fantastic. I truly was amazed at the cost as it was not as expensive as Petrus but I personally like this better. I would come back here for a date night dinner as both my wife and I liked it. Nice job with this one Gordon!

XpWIYj1YOCvwwZwtg8IJ1w.text: Maze........on Sunday..........White onion and thyme soup (really delicate flavours), Herefordshire Rib eye steak and Lemon tart. Great fresh ingredients, smart service, a nice bottle of shiraz......fantastic....The thick cut chips were outstanding and the peppercorn sauce added even more flavour.The only criticism was that the steak was slightly more medium than medium rare....not a disaster but a simple mistake. Fortunately the meat was so good anyway....Very enjoyable and will be returning.

fkWH4Glpy2ySESOwrZn_bQ.text: The food is off the charts - excellent - tasting menu is wonderful includes all the top dishes mentioned in the reviews excellent service - great night! / lobster dumpling is awesome and pork belly too . Go there - Gordon has got his kitchen humming!

Ac8QxiTQ3gKlh2ULXcHKug.text: I always make it a point to dine at one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants when visiting London. This time around, we had dinner at Maze. Three for three. Our best meal, yet again. Bravo Chef. Maze is a beautiful restaurant that also has the a more casual grill. The decor is sleek, hip and sexy. We were taken to a round section of the dining room and seated at a comfy two top that was nicely spaced from the other diners. That can be a problem, though I've never seen that at any of GR's places. I spied a cool looking chef's table towards the back that had a nice view of the kitchen where you can watch the craftsmanship up close. Pretty cool. Our server promptly greeted us and presented us with our menus. She explained that we may choose the Chef's tasting or dine a la carte and that the menu is designed tapas style with smaller portions. Many options and the tasting menu looked incredible. But, that's always tough for us to coordinate. We share everything anyway (you mean you don't?) so we would have our own tasting. Starters were the Salcombe crab, grapefruit fluid gel, mango, and wasabi ice cream and Marinated beetroot, Sairass cheese, pine nuts and Cabernet Sauvignon dressing. I liked the crab very much and the fruity accompaniments were tangy compliments to the fresh and light crabmeat. The beets were great too and Kris made short work of them, to the point where I barely got a bite. Round two was Orkney hand dived scallop, raisin and ginger vinaigrette, texture of turnips, crispy chicken skin and Halibut, carrot purée, caramelised endive, coriander, citrus glaze. Both excellent. Next for me was the Cornish lamb rack and shoulder, English garden mint gel. I had to have it and had the extra course. It was served nice and red. So good that I hardly noticed myself gnawing on the bone before my wife chided me for my caveman behaviour. The last dish we both had was the Roasted Muntjac deer, crushed celeriac, chestnuts, red cabbage and spiced chocolate jus. Again served perfectly cooked and on the rare side. Don't bother over cooking this as you'll want to enjoy this succulent cut of meat. It was delicious and the chocolate jus highlighted the many flavors that were part of this dish. We finished our wine and chatted with our Sommelier about her recent trip to Napa and how she was born in the region of France where we were enjoying our wine from. That was kind of cool. We contemplated the dessert choices and opted for the Peanut butter and cherry jam sandwich, tonka bean cream and dehydrated cherries. PB and J was never so good. I had high expectations for our evening at Maze and our meal here exceeded them in every way. The style of the restaurant was modern and cool, even the loo was hip. The service was spot on attentive and equally well dressed and well informed. The captain that stepped in to clear our dessert plate was able to tell us everything about it. I never felt rushed and we were never in need of having wine or water topped off. Staff was on top of it. We had a tasty amuse bouche which I've since forgotten. Portions were on the smaller side. But, that just meant we got to try more. Ingredient quality, creativity and preparation were top notch. If you leave hungry, you have yourself to blame. Reason enough for another flight across the pond. Until next time chef.....

hltEmXWjoC3AV_T5BrdbQQ.text: Great food but do not understand why the menu is so difficult to understand and the staff speaks very poor english.

7GzJdEHC3OQcjvDkpRT55Q.text: Wow!! I had never eaten (or wanted to eat) pigeon before but my friend ordered it and I tried it here. DELICIOUS!! It was sort of fried but so tender and well-flavored, it just fell off the bone. The other dishes were yummy with things like raw tuna spiced up and scallops. The wine specialist is fantastic and friendly. There were two the night I came. It was a litle funny though because one of them suggested a wine and then when he had gone and we asked the other one to give us the wine the first one suggested, , he didn't know wha it was. No worries though because we still go a great bottle. I also loved the peppermint / milky alcoholic beverage they serve as what I think is their signature cocktail. Great ambiance. Great food. Very pricy.

ZqF9jHcjPVfxzhgZ3ItQ2Q.text: Food exquisite, deserts good, wines very good except the red on the classic flight. Attention was very good. Coffee and tea a bit disappointing due to quality of coffee and lack of non-dairy milk options for tea.

86cCjXVOo1i0JP-KfQ817w.text: We made a reservation on OpenTable, which I was amazed to find working in London, but when we showed up on time, there was a wait for the table, about 15 minutes.  We ordered our drinks at the bar.The menu was short that we could hardly find 2 plates that we were excited to order.  The food was nothing inspiring or surprising.  The price was not cheap.  Service was ok.  Had to ask multiple times to get my water refilled.If you are looking some amazing food, that is not the place to go.  That 1-Michelin-star should go somewhere else.  Try La Cuisine de Joel Robuchon, at roughly the same price point (unless you order the tasting menu there, of course).  The other one I just tried that was great was Kitchen W9.
